title: Proper way to use Magneto Bold font?
content:
I have a client that wants to use Leslie Cabarga's Magneto Bold for a logo.

Am unsure if I'm supposed to kern the letters so there's no gaps in any of the text or if I'm supposed to leave some of them in. Any suggestions?

author: tomjonesrocks

comments.content: I would have to assume that Font Bureau's [sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20131221141246/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/Magneto) is what was originally intended. I would go with the standard tracking and kerning, but, as always, you should do what looks right.
You can also look at Leslie's own examples in his Logo, Font, and Lettering Bible
